data.title: Bitwise's Solana Spot ETF Sees Strong Inflows in Initial Trading Days
data.description: According to BlockBeats, Farside Investors reported that Bitwise's Solana spot ETF, BSOL, experienced consistent net inflows during its first three trading days. The total net inflow amounted to $152.5 million, indicating strong investor interest in the newly listed ETF.

data.title: OKX Wallet will adjust the Boost trading volume and balance calculation rules on November 3rd.
data.description: According to official news, OKX Wallet announced that it will update the calculation rules for Boost trading volume and balance starting at 8:00 AM Beijing time on November 3rd. After the adjustment, the calculation period will be shortened from 15 days to 10 days; users will receive an additional 20% bonus on their trading volume when trading designated tokens in the "OKX Boost" zone of the DEX; in addition, token pairs with a multiplier of 1X will be adjusted to 0.85X.

data.title: Crypto Market Sees Increased Bearish Sentiment on Altcoins
data.description:
According to BlockBeats, recent data from Coinglass indicates a shift in the crypto market sentiment, with participants showing increased bearishness towards altcoins following a period of decline. Meanwhile, Bitcoin's funding rate has returned to a neutral range.

Funding rates are fees set by cryptocurrency trading platforms to maintain balance between contract prices and the prices of underlying assets, typically applied to perpetual contracts. This mechanism facilitates the exchange of funds between long and short traders, without the platform charging this fee, to adjust the cost or profit of holding contracts, ensuring contract prices remain close to asset prices.

A funding rate of 0.01% signifies a baseline rate. When the rate exceeds 0.01%, it indicates a general bullish sentiment in the market. Conversely, a rate below 0.005% suggests a prevailing bearish outlook.

data.title: The Basel Committee on Banking Supervision is reassessing the crypto regulatory rules that will take effect next year.
data.description: The Basel Committee on Banking Supervision is reviewing its cryptocurrency regulatory framework, originally scheduled for implementation next year, with a focus on stablecoin-related regulations. Previous versions of the rules were widely seen as a warning to banks holding crypto assets due to their requirement for high capital commitments. Sources familiar with the matter revealed that major jurisdictions, including the US, UK, and EU, have not committed to proceeding as planned, but rather prefer to reassess the standards before widespread global implementation to ensure the feasibility and harmonization of regulatory measures. (Bloomberg)

data.title: Basel Committee Reevaluates Cryptocurrency Regulation Framework
data.description:
According to Odaily, the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision is reassessing its cryptocurrency regulation framework, initially set for implementation next year, with a focus on stablecoin regulations. The previous version of the rules was widely seen as a warning to banks holding crypto assets due to its requirement for high capital reserves.

Sources indicate that major jurisdictions, including the United States, the United Kingdom, and the European Union, have not committed to proceeding with the original plan. Instead, they prefer to reevaluate the standards globally to ensure the feasibility and coordination of regulatory measures.

data.title: ai16z gains as Binance announces AI16Z to ELIZAOS token swap
data.description:
AI16Z price has spiked more than 11% in the past 24 hours to hit $0. 069. Gains come amid Binance support for AI16Z to ELIZAOS token swap. ElizaOS is an AI project that rebranded from ai16z in January.
source: https://coinjournal.net/news/ai16z-gains-as-binance-announces-ai16z-to-elizaos-token-swap/

data.description:
